title: Refugees & Reparations (with Bell Ribeiro-Addy)
itunes:title: Refugees & Reparations (with Bell Ribeiro-Addy)
description:
Bell Ribeiro-Addy, Labour MP for Streatham, says Britain cannot wash its hands of Afghanistan now and the government must take in its fair share of refugees. Ribeiro-Addy also speaks to Bloomberg Westminister's Roger Hearing and Caroline Hepker about the devastating issue of maternal care for Black women and babies and why the government refuses to set targets for improving care.

As pupils in England and Wales go back to school, David Laws, Chairman of the Education Policy Institute, discusses the lack of funding for "catch-up" education and what that could mean for young people, as well as what should be done about GCSE and A Level exams.
